com.moosemorals.mediabrowser

Class PVR

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.moosemorals.mediabrowser.PVR
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TreeModel

     class PVR
extends Object
implements TreeModel
    Models a remote PVR.

    PVRs have folders that contain files. Files have a bunch of attributes. (Folders also have attributes).

    Author:
    Osric Wilkinson (osric@fluffypeople.com)

    • Method Detail

      • humanReadableSize

        static String humanReadableSize(long size)
        Convert a number of bytes into something more readable.

        Note that I've got no time for that "SI bytes" rubbish, 1kb is 1024 bytes.

        Parameters:
        size - long number of bytes to display
        Returns:
        String human readable String showing roughly the same number of bytes.

      • unlockFile

        void unlockFile(PVR.PVRFile target)
          throws IOException
        Unset the locked flag.

        This is one of the two core operations of this project. It connects to the PVR using FTP, fetches the PVR's control file, sets the value of a significant byte and uploads the file back to the PVR, over-writing the existing file.

        Using this method may be illegal in certain jurisdictions. Seriously. See this Wikipedia article to start with, and then talk to a lawyer.

        Parameters:
        target -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • start

        void start()
        Starts looking for devices to connect to. Starts a new thread and then returns. New devices will be reported asynchronously..

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stop any running threads and tidy up.

      • addFolder

        private PVR.PVRFolder addFolder(PVR.PVRFolder parent,
                      String folderName)
        Adds a Folder to the tree. Will return an existing folder if it can.
        Parameters:
        parent - PVR.PVRFolder parent, must not be null.
        folderName - String PVRs name of the folder.
        Returns:
        PVR.PVRFolder either an existing Folder, or a new one.
